titlestmt.titleproper:
Guide to the Kathleen Hanna Papers
1988-2005
MSS 271
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Liza Harrell-Edge, 2011. Reprocessed by Rachel Corbman, March 2013.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2013-04-01T16:27-0400

physdesc.extent: (10 document cases, 1 flat box, 2 binders and 1 oversize box)

did.abstract: Kathleen Hanna was an early instigator of the Riot Grrrl Movement, performing in bands such as Bikini Kill and Le Tigre. The Kathleen Hanna Papers consists of flyers, posters, zines and zine masters, notebooks, ephemera, magazines, photographs, media, newspaper clippings, theses and other academic writing, and legal and financial records. The collection documents Hanna's artistic production, participation in the Riot Grrrl movement, curatorial work, and musical career.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p:
Published citations should take the following form:
Identification of item, date (if known); Kathleen Hanna Papers; MSS 271; box number; folder number; Fales Library and Special Collections, New York University Libraries.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open to researchers. Appointments are necessary for the use of manuscript and archival collections.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Collection use is subject to all copyright laws. Permission to publish materials must be obtained in writing from the Director of Fales Library and Special Collections. Please contact fales.library@nyu.edu. or call 212 998 2596.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Archival Materials note
relatedmaterial.p:

Tammy Rae Carland Zine Collection
Riot Grrrl Publicity Collection
Mr. Lady Archive (unprocessed)

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: All efforts were made to preserve the original arrangement of the collection, with the exception of oversize materials and zine flats which are housed separately.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Kathleen Hanna was an early instigator of the Riot Grrrl movement in the early 1990's in both Olympia, Washington and Washington, DC. Along with Allison Wolfe she organized the first Riot Grrrl meeting, collaborated on several early Riot Grrrl zines, and was a major force behind the first Riot Grrrl Convention.

From 1990-1997 she was a member of the most widely recognized "Riot Grrrl Band", Bikini Kill. She co-authored the band's zines, including their 1992 Bikini Kill #2 which used the phrase "Girl Power" for the first time. Bikini Kill toured the states extensively and also played shows in Europe, Japan and Australia.

Her second large scale feminist DIY project was the electronic band Le Tigre which was active from 1999-2006. This band used activism as a jumping-off point for their visually stimulating live shows and their three full-length albums. Le Tigre played everywhere, from Massachussetts to St. Petersburg.
Hanna currently lives in NYC and is active as a musician and lecturer.

custodhist.head: Provenance
custodhist.p: The collection was donated to NYU Libraries in 2010.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The Kathleen Hanna Papers consists of flyers, posters, zines and zine masters, notebooks, ephemera, magazines, photographs, media, newspaper clippings, theses and other academic writing, and legal and financial records. The collection documents Hanna's artistic production, participation in the Riot Grrrl movement, curatorial work, and musical career.
The collection is divided into 5 series:

Series I: Filing Cabinet Files: This series is comprised of the contents of a filing cabinet that Hanna stored Riot Grrrl related materials in from the early 1990's until the collection was donated to Fales in 2010. The series contains flyers, posters, zines, notebooks and other materials related to the Riot Grrrl Movement; ephemera, press clippings, and legal and financial records of musical projects including Viva Knievel, Bikini Kill, Le Tigre and Julie Ruin; writing for spoken word performances and zines; materials that Hanna collected including articles with an emphasis on feminst theory, artwork by friends such as Tammy Rae Carland, and theses and other writing inspired by the Riot Grrrl movment and Hanna's work; photographs and other materials related to curatorial work at the Evergreen State College, Reko Muse and the Spring Street Gallery; personal materials including student records from Evergreen State College, personal legal and financial records, and a limited amount of correspondence from Johanna Fateman.
Series II: Photo Binders This series consists of photographs and negatives, mainly from 1987-1991, including work by Hanna.

Series III: Media This series contains VHS cassettes, 1/4" audio reels, mini digital video cassettes, CD-Rs and DVD-Rs, mostly documenting performances and studio recordings by Viva Knievel, Bikini Kill, Le Tigre and Julie Ruin.
Subseries A: Video - Access Copies
Subseries B: Video - Originals
Subseries C: Audio - Access Copies
Subseries D: Audio - Originals
Series IV: Computer Disks This series consists of 5 disks of data files, including image files used on Le Tigre's website.

Oversize Series I: Filing Cabinet: This series consists of oversize materials removed from Series I for preservation reasons. The folder titles of oversize materials are the same as the folders they were removed from.

processinfo.head: Processing Information note
processinfo.p: The collection was first processed in 2010. It was reprocessed in March 2012 to address preservation concerns. Materials were redistributed among more folders, and selected items were flattened or rehoused in Mylar. At this time, the collection was renumbered and box and folder numbers were changed. To see the original box and folder numbers, please ask a Fales archivist for a copy of the original finding aid, stored in our administrative files.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This series is comprised of the contents of a filing cabinet in which Hanna stored Riot Grrrl related materials from the early 1990s until the collection was donated to Fales in 2010. The series contains flyers, posters, zines, notebooks and other materials related to the Riot Grrrl Movement; ephemera, press clippings, and legal and financial records of musical projects including Viva Knievel, Bikini Kill, Le Tigre and Julie Ruin; writing for spoken word performances and zines; materials that Hanna collected including articles with an emphasis on feminst theory, artwork by friends such as Tammy Rae Carland, and theses and other writing inspired by the Riot Grrrl movment and Hanna's work; photographs and other materials related to curatorial work at the Evergreen State College, Reko Muse and the Spring Street Gallery; personal materials including student records from Evergreen State College, personal legal and financial records, and a limited amount of correspondence from Johanna Fateman.
